Allahabad High Court

Harshit And 3 Others vs State Of U.P. And Another on 6 December, 2024

Author:
Krishan Pahal

Bench:
Krishan Pahal

HIGH COURT OF JUDICATURE AT ALLAHABAD

?Neutral Citation No. - 2024:AHC:191464

Court No. - 65

Case :- CRIMINAL MISC ANTICIPATORY BAIL APPLICATION U/S 438 CR.P.C. No. - 11497 of 2024

Applicant :- Harshit And 3 Others

Opposite Party :- State of U.P. and Another

Counsel for Applicant :- A Kumar Srivastava,Rajesh K.S. Chaudhary

Counsel for Opposite Party :- G.A.,Gaurav Srivastav

Hon'ble Krishan Pahal,J.

1. List has been revised.

2. Heard Sri A. Kumar Srivastava, learned counsel for applicants and Sri Rajesh Kumar Srivastava, Advocate holding brief of Sri Gaurav Srivastava, learned counsel for the informant as well as Sri Sunil Kumar, learned Additional Government Advocate for State.

3. The present application for anticipatory bail has been filed for protection in regard to Case Crime No.106 of 2024, under
Sections 498A
,
,
,
,
I.P.C. and
Section 3
/
D.P. Act, P.S. Delhi Gate, District Aligarh.

4. After arguing for some time, applicants' counsel submits that the present application for anticipatory bail may bedismissed as withdrawn with a direction to file a regular bail application which may be decided keeping in view the guidelines as laid down by the Supreme Court in the case of
Satender Kumar Antil vs. Central Bureau of Investigation and another
reported in (2022) 10 SCC 51.

5. Learned A.G.A. and learned counsel for the informant have no objection to the prayer of learned counsel for the applicants.

6. After hearing learned counsel for the parties, no case is made out for interference U/s 438
Cr.P.C
. The present anticipatory bail application is disposed of with a direction that the applicants shall surrender before the concerned court within one month from today and in case a regular bail application is filed, the same be decided in view of the law
laid down by
the Supreme Court in case of
Satender Kumar Antil
(supra).

7. For the period of one month from today or till the time of surrender of the applicants before the concerned court, whichever is earlier, no coercive action shall be taken against the applicants- Harshit, Smt. Shakuntala Devi, Saksham and Km. Anshika
,
in
the above case
.

Order Date :- 6.12.2024

Ravi/-

(Justice Krishan Pahal)
